artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Published by Sakanaya Eikichi
creditline: Gift of Ruth Lathrop Sikes in memory of her brother Bruce Sikes, 1967
markings:
Censor: Kai, May 1857
Publisher: Sakanaya Eikichi
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Jñmantsubo (100,00 tsubo or about 8 acres) was a large tract of land along the coast of Susaki, on the outskirts of Edo. In illustrating this rather desolate area from a "bird's-eye" view, Hiroshige cleverly depicted an actual bird-an eagle. The print with the darker background (right) is from a later edition, although the deterioration of the woodblocks-discernable through slight discrepancies in registration-is hardly noticeable.
title: Fukagawa Susaki and Jūmantsubo
